item.title: Canada’s popular Jasper National Park ordered to evacuate as fire nears
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: An emergency alert warned residents and guests that they must be out by 3 a.m., with instructions to leave via the one remaining open highway.

item.title: China says Hamas and Fatah sign ‘Beijing declaration’ on Palestinian unity
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd, Vic Chiang
item.description: China hosted leaders from 14 Palestinian factions in an attempt to bridge divisions, part of Beijing’s effort to portray itself as a global mediator.

item.title: Why does China care about a rust bucket in the middle of the sea?
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee, Pei-Lin Wu
item.description: Beijing and Manila have struck a provisional deal to allow the resupply of the dilapidated Sierra Madre in the South China Sea, which has become a potential conflict point.

item.title: Ukraine confronts labor shortage as need for soldiers drains workforce
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Serhiy Morgunov
item.description: Ukraine’s urgent need for soldiers to fight Russia’s invasion is eroding the workforce and creating a drag on the economy but also new opportunities for women.

item.title: Israel orders evacuation of former Gaza safe area; U.N. aid convoy fired on
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Hajar Harb, Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu traveled to Washington, where the political turmoil was creating further uncertainty about U.S.-Israeli relations.

item.title: Russia sentences Russian American journalist to more than 6 years
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: The sentencing of Alsu Kurmasheva, an editor with Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, occurred the same day that Wall Street Journal’s Evan Gershkovich was sentenced on espionage charges.

item.title: A Chinese actor was enslaved in a compound running online scams
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd, Shibani Mahtani, Pei-Lin Wu
item.description: The United Nations estimated in a report last August that more than 200,000 people are being forced to work as scammers in Myanmar, Cambodia and Laos.

item.title: Netanyahu goes to Washington in the shadow of Middle East disaster
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: The Israeli prime minister is poised to address Congress with months of trauma and ruin looming behind him, and a murky political future ahead of him.

item.title: World leaders hail Biden’s ‘brave’ decision to end his 2024 campaign
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan, Anika Seth
item.description: Biden, who served on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee before ascending to higher office, nurtured relationships with many world leaders over decades.

item.title: See how Social Security retirement benefits stack up globally
item.dc:creator: Julie Weil
item.description: A look at how the U.S. public pension system stacks up to more than 100 others, in five charts.

item.title: Netanyahu comes to Washington as Biden withdraws from presidential race
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, John Hudson
item.description: The shifting political winds in Washington could empower Netanyahu, analysts said, at a crucial time in Gaza cease-fire and hostage-release negotiations.

item.title: Israel intercepts missile from Yemen after airstrikes on Houthi port
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Annabelle Timsit, Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Israeli forces said the missile was launched from Yemen a day after Israel struck a Houthi-controlled port there and two days after a rare Houthi attack in Tel Aviv.

item.title: ‘Magical’ self-portrait was hidden for decades — until the canvas was flipped
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih
item.description: The self-portrait by Norman Cornish, a celebrated 20th-century British artist, was found when a conservator removed a board at the back of another artwork.

item.title: Venezuela’s presidential election: How to run against an autocrat
item.dc:creator: Ana Herrero, Samantha Schmidt
item.description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, trailing challenger Edmundo González in polls, has stepped up repression ahead of what he pledged would be a free and fair election.
